    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 5,

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/faa9461eec21e858d92cac97318df7a18dead213/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fconfigure-security.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/faa9461eec21e858d92cac97318df7a18dead213/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fconfigure-security.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Ffundamentals%2Fconfigure-security.md?ref=faa9461eec21e858d92cac97318df7a18dead213",
    "patch": "@@ -14,13 +14,17 @@ ms.reviewer: ramical\n ---\n # Configure Microsoft Entra for increased security (Preview)\n \n-In Microsoft Entra, we group our security recommendations into several main areas. This structure allows organizations to logically break up projects into related consumable chunks.\n+In Microsoft Entra, we group our security recommendations into multiple themes based on the Secure Future Initiative (SFI). This structure allows organizations to logically break up projects into related consumable chunks.\n \n > [!TIP]\n > Some organizations might take these recommendations exactly as written, while others might choose to make modifications based on their own business needs. In our initial release of this guidance, we focus on traditional [workforce tenants](/entra/external-id/tenant-configurations#workforce-tenants). These workforce tenants are for your employees, internal business apps, and other organizational resources. \n \n We recommend that all of the following controls be implemented where licenses are available. These patterns and practices help to provide a foundation for other resources built on top of this solution. More controls will be added to this document over time.\n \n+## Automated assessment\n+\n+Manually checking this guidance against a tenant's configuration can be time-consuming and error-prone. The Zero Trust Assessment transforms this process with automation to test for these security configuration items and more. Learn more in [What is the Zero Trust Assessment?](/security/zero-trust/assessment/overview)\n+\n ## Protect identities and secrets\n \n Reduce credential-related risk by implementing modern identity standards."
  },

    "patch": "@@ -8,7 +8,11 @@ ms.date: 10/16/2025\n ms.custom: include file\n ---\n \n-\n+Assign the SharePoint Backup Administrator role to users who need to do the following tasks:\n+- Manage all aspects of Microsoft 365 Backup for SharePoint and OneDrive\n+- Back up and restore content including granular restore across SharePoint and OneDrive\n+- Create, edit, and manage backup configuration policies for SharePoint and OneDrive\n+- Perform restore operations for SharePoint and OneDrive\n <!-- autogenerated content starts here -->\n \n > [!div class=\"mx-tableFixed\"]"

    "patch": "@@ -20,6 +20,7 @@ This article provides information about new features and documentation improveme\n \n | Date | Area | Description |\n | --- | --- | --- |\n+|Nov 2025 | Roles | Updated [SharePoint Backup Administrator](permissions-reference.md#sharepoint-backup-administrator) role. |\n | Oct 2025 | Roles | Added [Dragon Administrator](permissions-reference.md#dragon-administrator) role. |\n | August 2025 | Roles | Added [Teams Reader](permissions-reference.md#teams-reader) role. |\n | June 2025 | Roles | Added [Organizational Data Source Administrator](permissions-reference.md#organizational-data-source-administrator) role. |"

]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response:
The changes primarily involve documentation updates for Microsoft Entra.

*   The **id-protection-guide-analyze.md** file has been significantly cleaned up, removing a large block of what appears to be extraneous content.
*   **configure-security.md** now mentions the Secure Future Initiative (SFI) and introduces the "Automated assessment" section, linking to the Zero Trust Assessment.
*   The **sharepoint-backup-administrator.md** include file has been expanded with a detailed description of the role's responsibilities, focusing on Microsoft 365 Backup for SharePoint and OneDrive.
*   Finally, the **whats-new.md** file has been updated to reflect the recent addition of the SharePoint Backup Administrator role.
